Admission_First_Year_Btech: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination of U.P. Board
10+2 level examination from any recognized board/university
Securing minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in total of required subject combination
Admission_First_Year_B.Pharm: Candidate must have passed (with/without grace) intermediate examination of U.P. Board
10+2 level examination or its equivalent with Physics and Chemistry
compulsory subjects along with Mathematics/ Biology subjects.
Admission_First_Year_MCA: The candidate must have passed three years degree course from any recognized University;
securing a minimum 50% (45% for SC/ST) marks in aggregate.
The candidate must have a minimum 50% (45% for SC/ST) marks in mathematics at 10 + 2 level or bachelor’s degree level.
Admission_First_Year_MBA: The candidate must have passed three years of degree course from any recognized University;
securing a minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in aggregate.
Admission_Lateral_Entry_Btech: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Engineering
securing a minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in mathematics.
Admission_Lateral_Entry_B.Pharam: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Pharmacy
Other_Process: The admission of NRI and Kashmiri migrants will be according to the norms laid down by the Govt of UP/AICTE
This admission test is open only for candidates who have passed the qualifying examination from any institution located in U.P and the parents, father/mother of the students must be domiciles of U.P

Fifteen percent (15%) of the approved: Intake of a course is filled under this category as per the Govt. of U.P. and AKTU guidelines
There is usually a great rush for management quota seats.
The students need to register themselves early to establish priority.
For admission to B.Tech courses: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination or equivalent (10+2) with required subject combination
The admission criteria is defined by the college admission policy.
For admission to the first year of MCA (: A candidate must have passed a bachelor’s degree course of three years minimum duration from any recognized Indian university or its equivalent.
Candidate must have passed Mathematics at 10+2 level
graduation level and the admission criteria are defined by the college admission policy.
For admission to MBA course: The minimum qualification required is three years of bachelor’s degree in any discipline
the admission criteria are defined by college admission policy.
For admission to PGDM course: Other criteria defined by the AICTE and affiliating University In PGDM Other criteria defined by the AICTE
For admission to M.Tech course: The minimum qualification required is a bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline.
MCA is also eligible for the admission to M. Tech (Computer Science & Engineering)
The admission criteria are defined by the college admission policy.

Twinning_Admission: A valid Passport with more than 4 years of expiry
Sufficient funds to manage visa, airfare and living expenses
Minimun 60% marks for Post Graduate Programs with minimum attendance criteria and no backlogs
